legal_basis: Subsection 83(1) of the Canadian Pension Plan (CPP)
procedural_fairness: PAB member must provide reasons for extending the 90-day appeal limit
four-pronged test: continuing intention, arguable case, reasonable explanation for delay, and no prejudice to the other party
decision_reasoning: granted leave to appeal five years after the deadline without stating reasons or applying the established test
result_of_case: application for judicial review is allowed
decision is set aside due to the lack of adequate reasons for the time extension
matter referred back for reconsideration with proper reasoning
cause_of_action: Respondent sought leave to appeal a dismissed disability benefits claim
citing language barriers and incorrect advice from her representative
